intro: Eloyella bifida, commonly known as the split-leaf eloyella, is a unique species within the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive bifid (split) leaves, which are often deeply divided into two lobes. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from pink to purple. Eloyella bifida is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
